intro: Diphasiastrum montellii, commonly known as the mountain spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant has a slender, upright stem with small, triangular leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its flowering structure consists of a spike of tiny, greenish-brown flowers that develop into dark, berry-like fruits. Diphasiastrum montellii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions and along stream banks.
